snippet: The iPad, considered a side business for Apple when it was introduced in 2010, accounted for $9.15 billion in revenue in the holiday quarter, about 20 percent of Apple’s total revenue.
abstract: Growing number of analysts and technology industry executives contend the torrid growth rates of Apple's iPad, combined with the likes of Amazon.com and Microsoft, will result in tablet devices outselling traditional personal computers; iPad, considered a side business for Apple when it was introduced in 2010, accounted for $9.15 billion in revenue in the holiday quarter, about 20 percent of Apple's total revenue.
lead_paragraph: The iPad, considered a side business for Apple when it was introduced in 2010, accounted for $9.15 billion in revenue in the holiday quarter, about 20 percent of Apple’s total revenue.

headline.seo: As New iPad Debut Nears, Some See Decline of PCs
headline.main: As New iPad Debut Nears, Some See Decline of PCs
headline.print_headline: In Flood of New Tablet Devices, Some See Decline of the Desktop Machine
